intro: Sida angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. Sida angustissima is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
